clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of High School Alcohol Policies on Students' Binge Drinking- a Natural Experiment
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of High School Alcohol Policies on Students' Binge Drinking- a Natural Experiment

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the project is to evaluate the effects of the introduction of new mutual alcohol policies in 30 high schools in 2017 on students binge drinking.

detailed_description.textblock:
In August 2017, 13 high schools in Zealand and all of Funen's 11 high schools and 6 high schools in Ringk√∏bing introduced new mutual alcohol policy for alcohol on study trips, parties, cafes and other social events.
The background for the introduction of the alcohol policies was the aim of reducing alcohol intake among students and that alcohol should have a less dominant role. By setting the same framework, the alcohol policies aims at promoting community, responsibility and respect.
The aim of the project is to evaluate the effects of the introduction of new mutual alcohol policies on students binge drinking.
The analysis is a natural experiment that compare binge drinking among students at schools after the introduction of the policy with binge drinking among students a schools that did not introduce the policy.

primary_outcome.measure: Binge drinking 4 or more times within the last month
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in the number of students that drink 5 or more drinks on the same occasion 4 or more times within the last month

arm_group.description: High schools that introduced the policy
High schools that did not introduce the policy

intervention.description: Introduction of new mutual alcohol policy

study_pop.textblock: The study population consist of high school students participating in the Danish National Youth Study 2014 and the Danish National High School Study 2019
